gov.usgs.anss.utility

Class MakeRawToMiniseed

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.utility.MakeRawToMiniseed
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MiniSeedOutputHandler

    public final class MakeRawToMiniseed
extends java.lang.Object
implements MiniSeedOutputHandler
    This class simplifies creating MiniSeed from a time series. When you create an object of this type the time series is created and Built into an ArrayList of MiniSeed which can be gotten by the user, or written to a file by the appropriate methods.

    Data from many channels can be processed through this object. There is an array where all blocks are concatenated and also an array list that is maintained with separate channels in each. Note the access methods or write methods are setup to do the whole array of by channel depending on the name.

      • getMiniSeedBlocks

        public java.util.ArrayList<MiniSeed> getMiniSeedBlocks(java.lang.String seedname)
        Return the MiniSeed blocks that resulted from creating this object.
        Parameters:
        seedname - The NNSSSSSCCCLL of the channel
        Returns:
        The array list with the data blocks for this channel (unsorted) or null if the channel does not exist

      • close

        public void close()
        use this to clear out the miniseed lists. If you do not do this and call many times you end up with a concatenated set of blocks from each call. Call this when all of the data on the miniseed lists has been processed and its time to free all of the space.
        Specified by:
        close in interface MiniSeedOutputHandler

      • putbuf

        public void putbuf(byte[] buf,
                   int len)
        this is used by the RawToMiniSeed code to send each block, the user of this class should not use this!
        Specified by:
        putbuf in interface MiniSeedOutputHandler
        Parameters:
        buf - Buffer of miniseed data
        len - length of buffer

      • loadTS

        public java.util.ArrayList<MiniSeed> loadTS(java.lang.String seedname,
                                            int nsamp,
                                            int[] data,
                                            int year,
                                            int doy,
                                            int secs,
                                            int mics,
                                            double rate,
                                            int activity,
                                            int IOClock,
                                            int quality,
                                            int timeQual)
        process a time series in an existing instance. All within this call - that is you are not going to incrementally add to this miniseed.
        Parameters:
        seedname - 12 character seedname
        nsamp - Number of samples in data[]
        data - The samples
        year - year of first sample
        doy - The day of year
        secs - seconds of first sample
        mics - Microseconds of first sample
        rate - the data rate in Hz
        activity - flag per SEED
        IOClock - flags per SEED
        quality - flags per SEED
        timeQual - The time quality 0-100
        Returns:
        THe ArrayList of MiniSeed of the resulting compressed blocks.

        process a time series in an existing instance. Remember to call close() if each time series is processed as you go (otherwise the blocks concatenate). This is used to incrementally add data to a miniseed.
